newsitem.title: SOUTH KOREA: S.Korean police fire tear gas at 20,000 workers.
newsitem.headline: S.Korean police fire tear gas at 20,000 workers.

text.p: South Korean riot police on Saturday fired tear gas to stop about 20,000 workers marching on a Seoul cathedral where union leaders are directing nationwide strikes, witnesses said.

Some of the largest demonstrations since work stoppages began two weeks ago followed attempts by police to arrest seven union leaders camped out in a makeshift tent on the grounds of Myongdong Cathedral.
The protesters, shouting "down with (President) Kim Young-sam", hurled stones at riot police in running battles in central Seoul, witnesses said.
Several protesters were led away by police.
There have been a number of violent clashes between striking workers and riot police since the ruling party rammed a controversial labour bill through parliament on December 26.
Union leaders have demanded the government scrap the new law, which allows employers to lay off workers, hire temporary workers to replace strikers and introduce flexible work hours.
